PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)

Concepts.longName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
Concepts.definition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measure proposed by Wolchok et al. (Clin Cancer Res 2009;15:7412-7420) to determine the extent of an antitumor response to a particular immunotherapeutic agent.

Concepts.longName: Modified Overall Immune Related Response Criterion
Concepts.definition: A measure proposed by Wolchok et al. (Clin Cancer Res 2009;15:7412-7420) to determine the extent of an antitumor response to a particular immunotherapeutic agent.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Version One Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Immunotherapy Response Assessment in Neuro-Oncology Criteria

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Immunotherapy Response Assessment in Neuro-Oncology Criteria
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Response assessment criteria for the evaluation of patients undergoing immunotherapy for the treatment of malignant glioma. These recommendations integrate guidance for the determination and confirmation of tumor progression based on the response assessment in neuro-oncology (RANO) working group and the immune-related response criteria (irRC).

Concepts.longName: Immunotherapy Response Assessment in Neuro-Oncology Criteria
Concepts.definition: Response assessment criteria for the evaluation of patients undergoing immunotherapy for the treatment of malignant glioma. These recommendations integrate guidance for the determination and confirmation of tumor progression based on the response assessment in neuro-oncology (RANO) working group and the immune-related response criteria (irRC).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Response Assessment in Neuro-Oncology Brain Metastases

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Response Assessment in Neuro-Oncology Brain Metastases
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A working group that is leading an international, multidisciplinary effort to develop standard response and progression criteria for use in clinical trials of treatment for brain metastases.

Concepts.longName: Response Assessment in Neuro-Oncology Brain Metastases
Concepts.definition: A working group that is leading an international, multidisciplinary effort to develop standard response and progression criteria for use in clinical trials of treatment for brain metastases.
